item.title: A bomb hit this theatre hiding hundreds - here's how one woman survived
item.description: The BBC speaks to survivors of the Mariupol theatre attack, who describe for the first time what happened.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban backtrack on reopening high schools for girls
item.description: Girls' high schools were ordered shut hours after they re-opened, sparking anger and frustration.

item.title: Olympic Park: Major gas leak incident at London Aquatics Centre
item.description: A number of people are being treated for breathing difficulties at the Olympic Park in Stratford.

item.title: Pressure on Sunak as inflation hits new 30-year high
item.description: Inflation hit 6.2% in February, laying bare the challenge the chancellor faces ahead of his Spring Statement.

item.title: Ashleigh Barty: World number one makes shock call to quit tennis
item.description: Australian player Ashleigh Barty - aged only 25 - says she will retire to "chase other dreams".

item.title: P&O says it did not break law as £100k payouts revealed
item.description: The firm says it didn't break law over sackings as it shares details of £36.5m compensation plan.

item.title: Angel Lynn: Kidnapped woman's abusive ex has sentence increased
item.description: Angel Lynn was left with life-changing injuries after being kidnapped by her then boyfriend.

item.title: Florida governor rejects transgender swimmer's win
item.description: Florida governor Ron DeSantis signs a proclamation recognising runner-up Emma Weyant as the winner of the highest US national college swimming title.

item.title: China plane crash: Search teams find flight's black box
item.description: Crews had struggled against rain and flooded terrain to find key clues to the plane’s sudden fall.

item.title: David Amess killing: Suspect looked 'self-satisfied' after attack
item.description: A murder trial was told a piercing scream was heard minutes after Ali Harbi Ali met Sir David Amess.

item.title: Child Q: Hackney mayor calls for school's head teacher to resign
item.description: Hackney's mayor says he has no confidence in the school leadership after a black pupil was strip-searched.

item.title: George Montague: Tributes to 'oldest gay' campaigner after death at 98
item.description: Pride director Paul Kemp said George Montague was "a lovely spirit" who "died a happy man".

item.title: What is the UK's inflation rate and why is the cost of living going up?
item.description: The chancellor is expected to set out plans on how to tackle the soaring cost of living on Wednesday.

item.title: Why is petrol so expensive and what is fuel duty?
item.description: UK fuel prices are at record highs and there are calls for the government to act.

item.title: How could the Chancellor's plans affect you?
item.description: The Ukraine war and rising living prices means Rishi Sunak faces pressure to take fresh action to help.

item.title: Five ways the Ukraine war could push up prices
item.description: Prices for everyday items could go up at a time when the cost of living is already rising.

item.title: Cost of living: 'It feels like I'm being priced out of existence'
item.description: Some disabled people say they are switching off their heating to cope with spiralling energy bills.

item.title: Cost of living: Calls for targeted help to cut energy bills
item.description: Millions of people may have to spend less on food and clothing to afford higher bills, an energy boss says.

item.title: War in Ukraine: 'Pets are getting left at train stations'
item.description: A photographer from the UK travels to western Ukraine to rescue pets displaced by war.

item.title: 'I was shocked to find out I now have four kidneys'
item.description: Transplant patient Stuart Middleton has both his kidneys - along with two he received from donors.

item.title: William Collins: Giant memorial built without permission
item.description: The huge marble tribute in Sheffield has become a minor attraction - but its future is in doubt.

item.title: Leicestershire boy with cerebral palsy learns to walk
item.description: Five-year-old Joey is taking steps after a life-changing operation and months of physiotherapy.

item.title: Laptop art: From Vans to Harry Styles
item.description: Photography student Thorsten Mjölnir captures the way students decorate their laptops.

item.title: CEO Secrets: 'Don't be trapped by your job title'
item.description: Roberta Lucca, co-founder of video games company Bossa Studios, shares her business advice for our CEO Secrets series.

item.title: Lockdown: How residents of London's Corona Road coped
item.description: Residents in one aptly named London street reflect on how their lives have changed over two years.

item.title: Homes for Ukraine: 'It's sad, slow and frustrating'
item.description: Families desperate to host Ukrainians in need call for the process to be quicker, with less red tape.

item.title: Teamsters: A sleeping American giant now spoiling for a fight
item.description: Teamsters were once known for Jimmy Hoffa and ties to the mob. Their new boss wants to take on Amazon.

item.title: When will free Covid tests end across the UK and can I buy LFTs?
item.description: Most free Covid tests will soon be scrapped in England, but will remain in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Oscars 2022: 18 bitesize facts about this year's nominees
item.description: A round-up of quirky facts and possible record breakers ahead of Sunday's Academy Awards.

item.title: Deplorable scam emails fake fundraising for Ukraine
item.description: Action Fraud warns of fake emails asking for donations to victims of the war.

item.title: Heat pumps: How do they work and how do I get one?
item.description: The government's grant support scheme for replacing gas boilers with heat pumps begins in April.

item.title: The Russians trapped on a Thai island as war rages in Ukraine
item.description: Thousands of Russian and Ukrainian tourists are stuck in Phuket, unable to go home.

item.title: Qatar World Cup: Eleven European nations battle for one of three places in finals
item.description: Eleven European nations are chasing the continent's final three Qatar 2022 World Cup places - and some big names are set to miss out.

item.title: When and where can I ride an e-scooter legally?
item.description: London is the latest UK city to trial e-scooters - which the government hopes will be a more environmentally-friendly way to travel.

item.title: Coronavirus: Where does the government borrow billions from?
item.description: How does it work when a government wants to borrow money, and when does it have to pay it back?

item.title: What are the UK's remaining Covid restrictions?
item.description: Almost all of the UK's Covid rules will have ended if Wales lifts restrictions as planned.

item.title: UK and Ireland FAs submit expression of interest on Euro 2028 bid
item.description: The UK and Republic of Ireland football associations submit a joint expression of interest in staging the European Championships in 2028.

item.title: Erik ten Hag: Manchester United speak to Ajax coach about manager's job
item.description: Manchester United speak to Ajax's highly rated coach Erik ten Hag about their vacant manager's job.

item.title: Beer throwing at Phoenix Open 'unacceptable' and will be 'addressed' - PGA Tour chief
item.description: The throwing of beer and water bottles at the Phoenix Open will be "addressed", says PGA Tour commissioner Jay Monahan.

item.title: 'We feel like we are building' - England captain Knight has eyes on World Cup semi-final
item.description: England will have no room for complacency when they meet Pakistan in the Women's World Cup, says captain Heather Knight.

item.title: Liverpool and Manchester mayors want FA Cup semi-final switched from Wembley
item.description: The FA Cup semi-final between Liverpool and Manchester City should be moved from Wembley, say the mayors of both cities.

item.title: MVP title bout off as Ukrainian champion joins fight against Russia
item.description: Ukrainian welterweight champion Yaroslav Amosov joins fight against Russia - meaning his bout against Britain's Michael 'Venom' Page is off.

item.title: A month in Ukraine: 'All normal life is gone'
item.description: The BBC's Sarah Rainsford travelled around Ukraine as the war started and lives were shattered.

item.title: Ukraine's recruits swap spreadsheets for sniper rifles to defend Kyiv
item.description: Preparing to defend Kyiv, Ukraine's new recruits must learn a new way of life - how to fight.

item.title: How many Ukrainians have fled their homes and where have they gone?
item.description: The UN says 10 million people have now fled their homes since the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

item.title: The hunt for superyachts of sanctioned Russian oligarchs
item.description: Wealthy Russians sanctioned by the US, EU and UK are having to find places they can keep their assets safe.

item.title: Ukraine: The small town which managed to block Russia's big plans
item.description: The mayor of Voznesensk hails the "fighting spirit" of local people who drove Russian troops back.

item.title: The popular apps aiming to tame the chaos of family life
item.description: How tech is helping young families and couples regain their busy social lives after Covid.
